intro: Medicago murex f. sphaerocarpos, commonly known as the spherical fruit variant of the Turkish clover, is a botanical variant characterized by its distinctive spherical seed pods. This form exhibits a compact growth habit and produces small, round seeds that are often used in traditional herbal practices. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
